metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40188 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Knot Resolver before 5.5.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because of algorithmic complexity. During an attack, an authoritative server must return large NS sets or address sets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 5.6.0-1
knot-resolver-module-http - 5.6.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1').
